definition: Foster or Forster (name)/Stephen Collins Foster (1826-1864), American composer
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: "Don't resort to the shotgun approach, " Forster advises.
sentences.chinese: “不要把网铺得太开，”福斯特建议。

sentences.english: John Foster held it to be the power of lighting one s own fire.
sentences.chinese: 约翰福斯特认为天赋是点燃自己热情的力量。

sentences.english: But the two men fell out in 1455, and Fust sued Gutenberg.
sentences.chinese: 但两人于1455年闹翻，福斯特控告了古滕伯格。

sentences.english: He is going to run against Foster.

sentences.chinese: 福斯特警官的脸变红了。

sentences.english: Justin Foster, a high school student, went missing last Friday night.
sentences.chinese: 贾斯亭福斯特是个高中生，上周五晚上失踪。

sentences.english: Foster already has been sworn into the office, which Hastert held for more than 20 years.
Sergeant Foster laughed but his face went red again.
sentences.chinese: 福斯特警官笑笑，他的脸却又变红了。

sentences.english: Chinstrap penguins gather on the beach at Port Foster on Deception Island, Antarctica.
sentences.chinese: 一群帽带企鹅聚集在南极欺骗岛福斯特港口的沙滩上。

sentences.english: Holloway was less gushing , but Foster could probably consider his assessment just as meaningful.
sentences.chinese: 霍洛威没这么激动，但是福斯特还是得到了不少表扬。

sentences.english: It is no surprise, then, that Forster felt sympathetic toward the Indian side of the colonial argument.
sentences.chinese: 毫不奇怪，那福斯特认为交感神经对印方的殖民论点。

sentences.english: Diane smiled again at Sergeant Foster and his face went redder.
sentences.chinese: 黛安娜又朝着福斯特警官笑，他的脸变得更红了。

sentences.english: Sergeant Foster waited by the door.

definition: Rice (name)/Condoleezza Rice (1954-) US Secretary of State 2005-2009
